pageContext.claim: “Since releasing my drug pricing blueprint in May, 16 drug companies reduced their list prices, rolled back increases, or froze their prices for the rest of the year. We called a few of those companies recently, where they raised their prices, and I guess maybe it was one of the times that I realized how powerful the presidency is, because they immediately rolled their prices back to where they started. And those companies know who we're talking about, and we appreciate it very much.”
pageContext.analysis: An AP investigation found that increases in drug prices may have slowed, but they are not going down.
